2 big-name questionnaires:  
NASA-TLX (Task Load Index) \- measuring subjective workload, includes mental physical demands, time pressure, frustration, feeling of effort.  
SUS (System Usability Scale) \- quick and dirty standard measure for usability more broadly.   
[https://www.uwalacrity.org/wp-content/uploads/2021/03/SUS.pdf](https://www.uwalacrity.org/wp-content/uploads/2021/03/SUS.pdf)

From testing:

Find out if users find the UI/UX good.

We intend to test the entire program. Users will interact with the frontend.

### **Interpreting the SUS Score**

* **Score \< 50**: Poor usability  
* **Score 50–70**: Marginal usability  
* **Score \> 70**: Good usability  
* **Score \> 85**: Excellent usability

SUS is a subjective tool but highly reliable, making it a standard in usability testing

![][image1]  
Method:

1. Before interaction:  
   1. Screen record. Record screens of our (team member) laptops.  
   2.   
2. After interaction: Microsoft Forms for SUS, as well as a few paper forms for those who couldn’t fill the online form.
